page.title: 10Lunardi's 1st Balloon Flight
page.content: A plaque is to be erected in October, near the spot on which Vincent Lunardi landed, to commemorate the bicentenary of his first Scottish flight. It will be unveiled by the Italian Consul-General in Scotland, Dr Carlo Marsili. Lunardi was an Italian, vain and adored by women. He always wore flamboyant clothes. On 5th October, 1785 he rose from the grounds of Heriot's Hospital in Edinburgh in his hydrogen balloon and drifted towards Ceres and when he arrived the workers below thought that something was falling from heaven! The field in which he landed is near Coaltown of Callange which nowadays consists of only two renovated country cottages.
